headline: Jewish Style Sweet and Sour Brisket
description: Tender beef brisket is cooked the day before, then served hot in a tangy and sweet gravy.

video.description: Make a Jewish-style brisket that’s sweet, sour, and delicious.
video.name: Jewish Style Sweet and Sour Brisket

name: Jewish Style Sweet and Sour Brisket

recipeInstructions.text: Heat brisket in a large skillet or dutch oven over medium-high heat. Cook until browned on all sides. Stir in water, ketchup, vinegar, onions, garlic, brown sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Continue simmering until tender, turning brisket occasionally, 2 hours and 30 minutes to 3 hours and 30 minutes.

Remove brisket and allow to cool before slicing the meat against the grain. Place brisket slices in a 9x13 inch baking pan or large platter and pour gravy on top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove any excess fat and reheat before serving.

review.reviewBody: I had to make it with beef chuck tender roast because there wasn't 4lbs of brisket at the store. I still sliced it all in a casserole dish when it was done, poured the juice over it to marinate, covered the casserole dish in aluminum foil and put it in the fridge overnight. I reheated it covered in the oven for 10 minutes and had it for dinner the next day. It was still a winner! Everyone loved it. Even my youngest who is a picky eater decided to have it in a sandwich and ate it all that way.
Fantastic recipe!! Comes out perfect everytime!

This is a really good recipe very flavorful and extremely tender. I have also used other cuts of meat, pork chops with and with out bone trim off all fat the first time I use the chops there was a larger amount of grease in the sauce. Also use flank steak comes out just like the brisket, going to try chicken next. I use more onions and extra sauce, there usually isnt a lot of leftovers. I’m making this for Christmas dinner I’ll upload a photo.
I make this recipe every year. I love that I get credit for making something so delicious when it’s so easy!
Love it

I've made this brisket twice now and everyone has just loved it! The only changes I made where to increase the sauce ingredients by 50%, which I felt was just right for a 4 lb. brisket. This will become a traditional meal for us for Passover. It feels like a recipe that's been handed down, so fits that special benchmark.
Very good. Made it as written and it was delicious. All 8 people who partook thought it was great.
I used cider vinegar instead of white and tossed some carrots in, this time. Smells amazing and the bits I snatched taste even better! I've made this several times, and it just keeps getting better.
Absolutely Fabulous! My family is from Kansas and so smoked brisket is the only way to eat it! But this recipe is fabulous! So different and such a good flavor! I will make it again and again.

I prepared this wonderful dish today! This was the first time I have ever made Beef Brisket let along try it. Since I was needing my oven I placed all ingredients in my crockpot. The aroma of this wonderful dish was very tempting to cheat and have a taste. I did turn it over 3 times while it was cooking. My husband came home and couldn’t wait for dinner because it smelled so good. It was very delicious and full of flavor. This recipe will be used again and again!! Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!!
This is a family favorite, I've made it many times and the only change I make is to replace half of the water with red wine.
Excellent recipe. The entire family gives it five stars.
Delicious!
perfect
No changes . Is delish.
Added some Balsamic Vinegar into the mix too. Ate the next day, both my sonn and husband pronounced it the best brisket yet.
Delicious! Although the ketchup flavor really comes through. Skipped the overnight step. Will make again.
Perfect. Needs no changes or modifications.

This is absolutely one of the Best briskets I've ever had!!! Can't wait to make it again. The only thing I did different is I didn't add the little bit of extra salt. Personally I believe Corned beef is salty enough, but that's just my taste. Bravo!!!
Brisket too fatty for us....don’t bother

I had something similar to this at a friend’s house. They had baked their brisket somehow but I figured I would make this & see if it was similar. It was close but not quite as good. In any event, I had a 2.5 lb brisket & made exactly as stated (I did not reduce the sauce ingredients). After 3 hours I figured it was done, rested it then sliced. It was tasty but not as tender as I had hoped. I sliced the leftover beef & refrigerated it overnight in the sauce In a casserole dish. Day 2, I heated the casserole at 350 for 40 minutes....it was definitely better...so tender & flavorful. So I think slicing it & waiting a day to eat it adds a lot to this recipe.

I prepared this brisket yesterday and finished it today. My hubby and I absolutely love it !! 
Great dish when you have company. Easy to make and delicious. Our side dishes were mashed potatoes, glazed carrots and broccoli.

My kids generally don't like big hunks of meat. They think it is hard to chew and jus doesn't taste yummy. They love this! Plus, I make the leftovers into pot pie and onion soup. This feeds my family of 6 for 3 dinners.
Very easy to make, I browned the brisket in a Dutch oven, then transfer it to a roasting pan, put all ingredients on top including carrots. Came out delicious. Will make again

I cooked the brisket exactly as the recipe suggested and it was fantastic. I would make it again. My husband said it reminded him of the brisket of his youth at a restaurant in Chicago. It was delicious and very tender.
I only changed the type of meat. I used a pot roast. This is delicious. It is better the next day and I will be making this again. I’m going to add carrots and new potatoes next time.

I cut the salt in half -- otherwise made exactly as written. Delicious. Not a scrap left. Will probably decrease the water by about 1/3 cup next time so my gravy is a little thicker. So good! Thank you!
This is the best brisket recipe ever! I made it by the recipe, it was so easy and quick. My family and friends loved it.
Definitely will make it again! I didn't change a thing, it was delicious.
Very delicious! I would just like my sauce a little thicker. It’s definitely a “Do-over recipe!”
This was good. Next time I will put it in the oven.
great recipe thank you for sharing

I added 3 pinches of dried chili pepper seeds (type you put onto of pizzas) added a little kick to it. Super simple to make and it was GREAT! Super moist, tender and great flavor. I am keeping this recipe for repeat and have shared with family.
I changed the vinegar to white wine. Very tasty. I will make this again. Just enough tang-good with a bit of barbecue sauce for a sandwich or good as a stand alone.

Turned out great, made it for Easter. We were tired of traditional ham or lamb cycle. Tender ,Juicy, big hit! Changes OH YEAH...recipe was for a four lb. brisket. I did a 10 pounder . Stole the cook times and temp and method from Blackjack Brisket.(kinda) pan browned, 275 degrees , foil covered, baked 7 ,hours.(no beer) Seasoned it with Pappy's Prime Rib Rub before browning, substituted red wine vinegar, head of garlic and , followed rest of recipe ( X3 amounts) and added multi-colored carrots for flavor and color.
Absolutely delicious. Tender, improved flavor the second day. I just should have used a deeper cast iron than just my large skillet. I made quite a mess!
Excellent recipe. So simple. Not sure the cooling is a requirement, but helps remove excess grease. Made it as written. Wife said I nailed it again. Thanks for the recipe. Definitely will fix again.
I made this to the letter. It was delicious
Difficult in the beginning, but definitely worth the time in the end.

Yum! Made for Easter Dinner and was a hit. Great flavor. Browned and simmered in large skillet with lid. Sliced and chilled overnight. The next day, skimmed the fat and baked 300 for couple hours before serving.
I really liked this receipt , a bit of work for 2 days but it is worth trying
The kids all went back for seconds!
All gone!! No leftovers!
Easy to make! Tender and delicious. Perfect Easter Dinner!

I made this with our Easter dinner and everyone flipped! My son said that this will now be his birthday dinner request for the rest of my life Lol. I did not change a thing except I made it early this morning then put it in the refrigerator and heated it up just a half hour before serving it. I had 20 people for dinner and everybody said it was the best brisket they ever had. This one is a big winner !
I didn't change much about the recipe except I halved it for a small brisket. That worked out fine. Served with mashed potatoes and green beans.
followed the recipe as written. so incredibly easy and perfect flavor and tenderness. a huge hit.

This was delicious and super tender. I made it almost exact to original recipe. I used brown coconut sugar instead of what was listed and added chopped fresh carrots to the juice and served over jasmine rice. The carrots were divine! But I think the coconut sugar needed to be adjusted to a little less. I have another one in my oven right now with adjusted amount. My house smells as incredible as did the first time. Thanks for sharing this gem!

I was hungry for waffles but I did not want maple syrup on them; I looked for a recipe for fried apples to use as a topping and found Sautéed Apples. I followed the recipe exactly as it was written; it does not take long to prepare and the apples with the sauce taste great. My entire family loved it and requested me to make it again!
Simple easy and very tasty

I am ashamed to say that at 65 years old, this is my first brisket that I have made. It is for Passover/Easter and it is delicious.
The recipe was so easy to make and the smell is tremendous in the kitchen. The only problem I had was purchasing the brisket. It was a 6 pounder (the only one) and I had the butcher cut it in half. (we are empty nesters) I cooked one and froze the other. EXCELLENT RECIPE!!

Made this according to recipe. I used 1/2 Tbs of salt. I did add some mushrooms, not carrots. Cooked about 2 & 3/4 hours. This does turn a piece of inexpensive meat/brisket into a very good dish. I trimmed the brisket of excess fat diligently before cooking. The 'rest' overnight in the sauce, I'm guessing, is to infuse and 'pickle' the beef in the vinegar? I will make this again and cook more toward the 3.5 hour time. Thanks for a memorable recipe.
This was great. Can't run to town sometimes so i have to use what we have. "ELK". I followed the recipe exactly as written and it made the elk roast tender and yummy.

I'm not a great cook, so I'm leery of recipes. But I made this for upcoming Passover, and it's delish. So easy. The trick is to be patient and slow simmer as long as it takes to get fork tender, which could be over 3 hours. I used a thin cut of Angus beef brisket. Remember to sear it first on both sides before adding the other ingredients. I used a Dutch oven with a cover. I substituted apple cider vinegar and used 2 large vidalia onions. Thank you for this recipe! You've made a cook of me at last!
I am a pescatarian, so I substituted the beef for mahi mahi. It was really good.
My go to brisket recipe. Instead of 1 cup ketchup, I use 1/2 cup ketchup and 1/2 cup chili sauce. Cuts down on the sweetness and adds another layer of flavor. Easy and delicious!
This is the recipe I've been using for years, and my son says it's the best brisket ever. I also add carrots and mushrooms.
I prepared this dish and I have only one comment...DELISH!
Used a slow cooker, 6 hours on low was a little too long but still delicious. I did use 2 tsp. Salt instead of 1 T and I think it was just right.
It was just as delicious as they said. Made it exactly as recipe calls for. Ate it the night I made it and scrumptious as leftovers the next night.

Slow cooking the beef brisket is the key to a savory brisket. This recipe was good but I still haven't found the recipe that was as mouth watering as my aunt's at passover. I think I might be missing the sweet wine.

I have been on this site for almost 10 years and this is my first post. I’ve made some great recipes on here but this one blew me away. I made the worst brisket last year in the oven, it got all dried out and nobody ate it so for the first night of Hanukkah I wanted to make it up to my family. Well, they told me hands down it was the best meal I had ever made! Followed the recipe exactly as directed and it couldn’t have been easier or more delicious. Thank you!
I’d like to make this in a slow cooker. Can I do that and how long should I set the slower cooker?

I have been making this recipe for years. I sprinkle the meat with onions soup mix and then pour the sauce over the meat. Cover tightly and roast in the oven for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. It has to chill overnight in order to slice easily and cleanly.
This was amazing. All of my picky-eater children licked their plates. Enough said. Followed recipe to the letter (except I used apple cider vinegar).
Loved this recipe! I make it every year for the Jewish holidays!
One of the best briskets I've ever made. There wasn't even a shred of meat left either time I made it; second time I cut back some on the sugar but preferred the taste of the first one.
Everyone LOVES this recipes. Simple to make and delicious every time!!
My Family couldn't get enough! A rounding success!
Best brisket ever! I've made is now forall of the Jewish holidays over the past 8 years since learning about the recipe.

How did Howard Wolowitz stay so skinny, with Mamma Wolowitz cooking Brisket like this for him all the time? YUM! This was amazing! And I believe the overnight waiting period is driven by the fact that it seems to get better every time you heat up the leftovers. Will definitely be making it again and again.

Used ingredients listed, except I was out of white vinegar, so I substituted apple cider vinegar. I put the brisket in the crockpot and then mixed the remainder of the ingredients together and poured over the top. Cooked on Low for 11 hours and then followed the remaining instructions. Meat was delicious and I didn’t have to babysit it at all by using the crockpot!

have made this many times, served to easily 125 plus different people, nothing but rave reviews, never found anyone that did not love it! as well as it is very forgiving, never bother exact measurements and always make extra "gravy", trust me, there are many uses for it!!
Delicious. Made it exactly as recipe described.
This was very good! I made 3 lbs and put it all in the crockpot on low for 6 hours. I did not wait overnight. Served it right away.
followed the recipe exactly. we didn't care for it.

First brisket I ever made, and it was superb!
Made it like the recipe except I didn't have enough catsup so I added some chili sauce to make the 1 cup. It was tender and so delicious. Served with roasted carrots and asparagus, and mashed potatoes.

My Guests RAVED!! I followed the recipe. But I worried that I had overcooked the brisket. So when I sliced it and put it in the 9 x 12 to sit in the fridge - I added a can of beef broth to make sure it was moist. And it was!! This one gets printed to put in the "family favorites" binder.
Great for this year’s last night of Hanukkah party. Only change I made was to use white balsamic vinegar. Not sure it improved it, but it didn’t hurt.

This was a very good and easy recipe. I did use apple cider vinegar instead of the white and we ate it the day it was made instead of letting it refrigerate overnight. The only thing I would probably change is after slicing it I wouldn’t put it back into the sauce. It was good for the original cook but I felt it was a little overwhelming in the end. I would’ve liked to taste the actual meat and not just the sauce with the texture of meat.
Wow!! Brought me back 40 years when my Grandmother made this as my favorite birthday dinner. Only change, used apple cider vinegar. Delicious!!!

This is the best brisket and the best recipe out there. I make it every year for the holidays and it’s a hit. If you cut it and freeze it ahead of time it is even better when you warm it up for the holidays.

Loved!! I do have to admit that my review is mostly for the sauce, because unfortunately I did not have beef brisket and used chuck roast (came out delicious cooking it as the recipe states, though only for around 2 hours). The sauce has a delicious home-made barbecue taste to it, but I personally had to make a slurry (2T flour + 2C of the sauce) so it would be more on the gravy-ish side. This will be made again!
this was great for Rosh Hashana, very delicious, will make again
a foodie we invited for Rosh Hashanah dinner said this was the best he ever had! Loved it!

Excellent!!!!! So easy and so delicious!!! I've made it twice so far and will continue to in the future. I used cider vinegar only because I didn't have any regular vinegar on hand. Also I didn't have time to let it rest overnight but I will try that as I'm sure it will only make the flavors bind together to make it even more delicious. So delicious you have to make this! Thank you for the great recipe!

I would put 6 stars if I could. Supper.
I followed recipe and only thing I did different, I baked it. Came out Supper!
I made it second time and modified it slightly: onion and garlic I chopped in food processor to almost liquid conciseness. Also I tiny sliced small onion and put it on the bottom of aluminum form, then put a brisket and pour sauce over it. Covered form and baked for 2hrs at 375F. Then sliced brisket and baked another 2hrs. Came out supper! ! ! However when I reheated it next day it came a little bit dry. Next time will need to experiment with it or even better, cook at the day of party. It is a super-duper recipe!!!
I use barbecue sauce instead of ketchup. Delish
Everyone loves this dish when I make it.
5.5 lb. brisket fed 9 hearty eaters. Followed recipe with inflated amounts of all ingredients, prepared it 2 days prior, and everyone loved it.
I followed this recipe and it was excellent! Great recipe for my very first beef brisket.
I used Apple Cider Vinegar instead of White Vinegar. It was fantastic. Best brisket I ever made.
Perfect! My family loved this recipe. I did add some black pepper towards end of cooking. It was so easy to make and so good.

I LOVE THIS. I've recommended this to family, friends and coworkers. Perfect amount of seasoning, sweetness and flavor, and oh, so moist. Can't go wrong with this one. 
We've even brined it raw in all the ingredients then smoked it on the grill. I used the liquid to baste every hour and heated it to be used as a gravy. 
I've also quartered some potatoes and cooked them in the liquid too! Next time I'm going to add some carrots and cabbage! Fresh mushrooms! Get creative with this!

Outstanding recipe ! I had a 2 lb trimmed kosher brisket so I halved the recipe and followed exactly except by using my pressure cooker. It took about 1 h 15 minutes, opening once to flip the piece of meat.
The overnight step is mainly to remove the excess fat. I just ladled the sauce in a bowl and refrigerated it for couple of hour to allow the fat to solidify and then discarded it. I poured the sauce back over the sliced meat in the pot and heated up right on the stove.

This is one of the tastiest dishes I have ever made! I'm not Jewish and I was not familiar with cooking brisket this way. Man, what I have been missing! Every family member I've made this for has loved it. It's so much fun to find a new dish to make. I did put extra garlic and I used apple cider vinegar. Thanks for sharing!

I made this last night and it was delicious. I did add a little bit of Worcestershire to it and I also added potatoes to it. It came out perfect. I also used a oregano white vinegar that I had on hand as well. Just delicious.
I am making it at the request of family members. They loved the first one. I mixed some BBQ sauce in place of ketchup.
Came out perfect the first time I tried it... I am now on my 5th time making it... and have passed it on others....

item.name: Jewish Style Sweet and Sour Brisket
